poem:
"Defiance in Hushed Chambers"

In the quiet hollows of power,
so much red ink –
Biden, fierce against the storm. 
Carnage penned on paper,
in silence stark as winter's sleep.
"Right," he whispers to the mirror,
over the clamor of regrets. 
No resignations, only echoes,
and the weight of the sky 
on shoulders stooped yet unbowed.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Biden ‘privately defiant’ over chaotic 2021 Afghanistan withdrawal, book says Joe Biden is “privately defiant” that he made the right calls on the US withdrawal from Afghanistan in summer 2021, a new book reportedly says, even as the chaos and carnage that unfolded continues to be investigated in Congress. Related: Pentagon to interview more troops over 2021 Kabul airport suicide bombing “No one offered to resign” over the withdrawal, writes Alexander Ward, a Politico reporter,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Biden ‘privately defiant’ over chaotic 2021 Afghanistan withdrawal, book says Joe Biden is “privately defiant” that he made the right calls on the US withdrawal from Afghanistan in summer 2021, a new book reportedly says, even as the chaos and carnage that unfolded continues to be investigated in Congress. Related: Pentagon to interview more troops over 2021 Kabul airport suicide bombing “No one offered to resign” over the withdrawal, writes Alexander Ward, a Politico reporter,
